comment.author: 22948027@N02
comment._content: Text in Norwegian, picture one and two: Halen kappes efter at hvalen er lagt i slep - The whale tail is cut away when the whale is secured for transporting (back to the factory). This was done for practical reasons, the tail interfered with hauling the whale. Third picture: Hjem med byttet - homeward bound with the catch Fourth picture: Hvalbaat under slep set fra ... - Whale catcher hauling whale, seen from ... (unreadable, but obviously the picture is taken from the look-out). The whale is secured alongside the ship, to the left. Fifth picture: Avlevering av fangsten paa havnen - Delivering the catch in the harbour. The ship is identified on the negative as HB Knöl.
